--- title: Predictive decisioning 300-level live demo description: Predictive decisioning 300-level live demo tabs: [ 'Demo preparation', 'Demo script'] --- export const Title = () => ( Predictive decisioning
300-level live demo ); ![banner](./images/proactive-incident-resolution-300-script-github-banner.jpg) BANNER NEEDED | DEMO OVERVIEW | | | :--- | :--- | | **Scenario overview** | This demo shows how the IBM Cloud Pak for Business Automation integrates machine learning to improve decisions. To illustrate this, a company’s customer retention offer process is automated. | | **Demo products** | Cloud Pak for Business Automation V21.0.2, Cloud Pak for Data 4.0 | | **Demo capabilities** | Decision management, Predictive Services integration, Rapid application development | | **Demo guidance** | This demonstration uses three main components from two Cloud Paks:

1. **IBM Watson Studio** - AutoAI form Cloud Pak for Data (AI part)

2. IBM Business Automation Studio / **Automation Decision Services (ADS)** in Cloud Pak for Business Automation (Business rules part)

3. IBM Business Automation Studio / **Application Designer** in Cloud Pak for Business Automation (Final application part)

This demo script has multiple tasks, that each have multiple steps. In each step, you have the details about what you need to do (**Actions**), what you can say while delivering this demo step (**Narration**), and what diagrams and screenshots you will see (**Screenshots**). This demo script is a suggestion, and you are welcome to customize based on your sales opportunity. Most importantly, practice this demo in advance. If the demo seems easy for you to execute, the customer will focus on the content. If it seems difficult for you to execute, the customer will focus on your delivery. | | **How to get support** | Contact #itz-techzone-support regarding issues with reserving and provisioning TechZone environments.

Contact #platinumdemos-automation-support regarding issues with setting up and running this demo use case. |
Introduction
To install the demo, complete these steps in advance:

1. Create your **Cloud Pak for Data** account, and subscribe to **Watson Studio** and **Watson ML**.
2. Have an installation of **Cloud Pak for Business Automation** up and running, or provision a demo instance on ROKS. ### First demo installation process This guide explains how to install and connect the three required environments.
Here is a visualization of this guide’s steps in this guide.

**[Go to top](#top)**
1 - Provision the Cloud Pak for Business Automation environment
Install Cloud Pak for Business Automation 21.0.2, or provision a ROKS environment that will be available for one week at no charge. To book your ROKS instance, follow these steps:

1. Log in to IBM Technology Zone.

2. Click the **Activation Kits** tab (1) and then select the **Cloud Pak for Business Automation Activation Kit** tile (2).

3. Click **Environments - Reserve here!** tab.

4. Select the **Cloud Pak for Business Automation OpenShift Demo Environments** tile.

5. Click the **Preinstalled OpenShift Environments** tab (1) and then the **Preinstalled CP4BA - V21.0.2IF003 on Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud (ROKS)** tile (2).


6. Select **Reserve now**. Enter the requested information and select a preferred location to host your instance.


7. You will receive a confirmation email that confirms the instance is provisioning.

8. You will receive a second email once the environment is provisioned. This email contains information, such as URLs, that allow you to connect to the instance.
If you have issues connecting to your instance, please contact TechZone support or refer to the installation documentation here.


9. Once you receive this email, it will take an additional 6-8 hours for the system to fully install Cloud Pak for Business Automation. After the waiting period is over, click the **Cluster URL** from the email you have received.

10. Ensure you are on the **ITZ account**.

11. Ensure there are no **Alerts** for the cluster.

12. Click the **OpenShift web console** blue button on the top right corner of the screen.

13. Expand **Workloads** (1) and click **Config Maps** (2).

14. Select the **dtecp4ba** project.

15. Search for **access** in the search area.

**Note**: If your CP4BA install process went well you should see the file called “icp4adeploy-cp4ba-accesss-info”. If not, please refer to the ROKS help or contact the TechZone support: techzone.help@ibm.com .

16. Click the **icp4deploy-cp4ba-access-info** file.


17. Scroll down to the **BAStudio** section.

18. Bookmark the **environment URL** (1) and keep a copy of the username and password (2) to log in CPABA.


19. Scroll down to the **gitea-access-info** section and note the credentials that are necessary when setting up ADS.


20. Connect to your gitea environment using the URL and credentials provided. Click through the privacy messages and click **Sign In**.

21. Enter the same **Username** and **Password** (1) provided in the access file and click **Sign in** (2).

22. Click **+** to create the git repository.

23. Name the repository **“SkyTalk_customer_retention.”** (1). Click **Create repository** (2).

**Note**: Ensure there are no spaces in the name.

24. Keep a copy of the repository URL required later for the ADS configuration.

**[Go to top](#top)**
2 - Create and set up your Watson Studio account (free)
1. Go to IBM Cloud.

2. Enter your **IBM ID**. If you do not have one, create a new one.

3. Click **Create resource**.

4. Type **Watson** (1) in the search field and then select **Watson Studio** (2).

5. Select the **Lite** plan (1), and a **location** (2). Read and accept **license agreements** (3). Click **Create** (4).

6. Return to the **IBM Cloud**.

7. Click **Create Resource**.


8. Type “Machine”(1) and then select **Machine Learning** (2).

9. Select the **Lite** plan (1) and a **location** (2). Read and accept **license agreements** (3). Click **Create** (4).

10. Return to the **IBM Cloud**.

11. Click **Create Resource**.

add links 12. Type **Object** (1) and then select **Object Storage** (2).

13. Select the **Lite** plan (1), and click **Create** (2).

14. Click the **top menu** (1) and then **Resource list** (2).

You should see your three services. Click **Watson Studio-2D**.

15. Click **Launch in IBM Cloud Pak for Data**.

16. Click **New deployment space**.

17. Name the production space "**SkyTalk production space**" (1). Set Cloud the storage service to **Cloud Object Storage-ep** (2). Set the **Machine Learning-nm** to **Create a new machine learning service** (3). Click **Create** (4).

18. Click **Close**.

19. Click the **IBM Watson Studio** logo at the top left-hand side of the page to return to the home page.
**[Go to top](#top)**
3 - Set up the two Machine learning models
At this stage, the Watson Studio environment is completely set up. The three services (Watson Studio, ML, and Storage) are ready, and the deployment environment is set up. Now let’s create the two prediction services using AutoAI in Watson Studio.
Ensure the 2 data files have downloaded prior to starting this step.


(ADD LINKS)

1. Click **New Project** from the Watson Studio home page.

2. Select **Create an empty project**.

3. Name your project **"SkyTalk customer retention"** (1) and click **Create** (2).

4. Click **Add to project**.

5. Select **AutoAI experiment**.

6. Name your AutoAI experiment **SkyTalk churn prediction** (1) and click **Associate a Machine Learning service instance** (2).

7. Select your service instance (1). Click **Associate Service** (2) in the blue ribbon.

8. Click **Reload**.

9. You should be ready to click **Create**.

10. Click **Browse**.

11. Select the **SkyTalk customer loyalty data.csv** file you downmloaded from.

12. When prompted **"What do you want to predict?"**, select **Churn**.


13. Click **Run Experiment**.

14. Let the tool work (two minutes) until the eight pipelines are created.

15. Scroll down to access the pipeline list, and **Save as** Pipeline as a model.

16. Select **Model**, and click **Create**.


17. You should see a **Saved Model Successfully** message.

18. Return to the **SkyTalk customer retention** project.

19. Click **New AutoAI experiment**.

20. Repeat the operation to create a new AutoAI experiment from another data file. Repeat all the steps from bullet 9, and browse the **SkyTalk customer value data.csv** file (1). Name your experiment **SkyTalk lifetime value prediction** (2), and select **Lifetime value** (3) as the column to predict.

21. After creating the model (->step 18), return to the project view. Click **SkyTalk customer retention**.

22. At this step, you should have your two models ready to be published in your deployment space.

23. Go over the first model, and click **Promote**.

24. Select your deployment space and click **Promote**.

25. Repeat the instructions from **step 23** with the second model.

26. Return to the IBM Watson Studio home page, and click your deployment space.


30. Go in the **Assets** tab.

31. Your two machine learning services are now ready to be deployed.
**[Go to top](#top)**
4 - Deploy your ML models
Your ML services will be accessible to other applications once deployed. 

**NOTE:** Your free quota will be consumed as soon as the service is deployed. Don't forget to remove the deployments as soon as you are done with your demonstration. Follow the **Un-deploy your ML models** step to un-deploy the services and to stop the billing process.
1. From your Watson Studio environment, go in your deployment space.

2. Go to the **Asset** tab.

3. Deploy the CHURN prediction by clicking the corresponding rocket icon that appears when you hover the RHS of the row.

4. Select **Online** (1) and name your deployment **Churn** (2). Then click **Create** (3).

5. Deploy the lifetime value prediction clicking on the corresponding rocket icon that appears when you hover the RHS of the row.

6. Select "online" (1) and name your deployment "Lifetime value" (2) and click **Create** (3).

7. Click the **Deployment** tab. Your two services should be deployed.

**NOTE:** You are now charged until you remove the deployments from that table by selecting **Delete** on the right hand side of the row. This is the un-deploy phase which you will have to perform after each demo.
**[Go to top](#top)**
5 - Get the credentials to set up the ML provider
This section explains how to get the various elements needed to set up the machine learning provider in ADS. 1. Go in your deployment space / deployment tab (1) and click the **churn** deployment (2).

2. Copy the **endpoint URL** path (the selection highlighted in blue) and keep it handy for the upcoming ML provider configuration.

3. Click **SkyTalk product space** in the breadcrumb menu.

4. Go to the **Manage** tab.

5. Copy the deployment **Space GUID** by clicking on the **Copy** icon. Keep it handy for the upcoming Machine Learning provider configuration.

6. Log out and return to your IBM Cloud environment (1) and make sure you are on the account used to set up Watson Studio (2).

7. Go in the **Manage** tab, and select **Access (IAM)**.

8. Click **API keys** (1) and then **Create an API key** (2).

10. Give a name to your key (1) and click **Create** (2).

11. Download the API key file and keep it ready for the ML provider configuration.

**[Go to top](#top)**
6 - Open ADS and import your ADS demo project
In this step, you are going to import the rules project in ADS. Make sure you have uploaded the ADS project file called "SkyTalk-Customer-Retention_21.0.2_Vxx.twx". ADD LINK once posted
1. Log in to your Cloud Pak for Business Automation instance. Use the URLs and credentials from **steps 1-25** in this documentation if you are using ROKS.

2. Expand the top menu (1) and click the Business Automation menu (2).

3. Pass through the privacy warning messages by clicking "Advanced " and then "Proceed..." link

4. Under **Business automations**, click **Create / Decision automations**.

5. Name your automation **"SkyTalk customer retention DS"** (1) and click **Create**. (2)

6. Accept any privacy checks that may appear.

7. Close any Guided tour views.

8. Click the "Import" button.

9. Select your **"SkyTalk-Customer-Rentention_21.0.1_VXX.zip"** file and click **Open**. ADD LINK WHEN POSTED

10. Click "Import".

11. Configure your ADS environment by clicking "..." and then **Settings** next to the project name.

12. In the **Remote Git repositories** tab, copy the git repository URL from step 1.21 (1). Enter the git username and password you have in your ROKS access file (see step 1.21). (2) Click **Connect**. (3)

13. Ensure the **Remote Git repository** status is **Connected.**

14. Make sure your two ML services are deployed on the IBM Watson studio side (refer to step 4).

15. Click the "Machine learning providers" tab to configure the machine learning provider.

16. Click **New**.

17. Name your ML **"SkyTalk ML provider"** (1). Enter the API key (2), Space ID (3), and URL (4) that you got from step 5 and click **test connection**.

17. Your ML provider should be up and running. Click **Save**.

22. Click **SkyTalk customer retention DS in the breadcrumb**.

**[Go to top](#top)**
7 - Update the decision model with the deployed ML models
1. Click the **SkyTalk retention decision service** tile.

2. Click the **Customer Churn** model.

3. Click**Connect**.


4. Select your ML provider.

5. Expand the churn prediction model (1), select your churn deployment (2), and click **Next** (3).

6. Click **Next**.

7. Click **Run** to test the invocation.

8. Click **Next**.

9. Click **Generate from test output**.

10. Click **OK**.

11. Click **Apply**.

12. Return to the skytalk retention DS.

13. Click **Customer lifetime value** and repeat operations 3 to 12, expending and selecting the **Customer lifetime value ML** model.

14. When that is complete, click the **Retention Offer** model.

15. Select the **Run (3)** tab.

17. Select the **High Value profile** test file (1) and click **Run** (2).

18. You should see a retention offer with an upgrade to PREMIUM for Sarah Miller displayed. Click run again if you get a timeout error the first time. Click **SkyTalk customer retention DS**.

**[Go to top](#top)**
8 - Deploy your Decision service
1. Select the **Share changes** tab.

2. Select all the changes (1) and click **Share** (2).

3. Click **Share** to push your updates to your git repository.

4. Go into the **View history** tab.

5. Refresh the page and click **Version +** in your latest shared history.

6. Enter version name **"V1"** (1) and click **Create** (2).

7. Click the **Deploy** tab.

8. Expand your latest version (V1) (1), and click **Deploy** (2) in the SkyTalk retention DS row. **Note**: Do not deploy the Skytalk initial retention DS.

9. Click **Deploy** to confirm.

10. Once the deployment is finished, select the **Business Automation** tab.

11. You should see your latest deployed service. Click **Publish**.

12. In the **Publish automation services** window, click **Publish**.

13. Confirm the service appears as **Published**.

**[Go to top](#top)**
9 - Configure Application Designer and import the client application
For this step, make sure you have downloaded the **SkyTalk_call_center_application_21.0.2_Vxx.twx** archive file.

INCLUDE LINK 1. Open the top menu (1), go into **Design** (2), and click **Business applications** (3).

2. Click **Import**.

3. Click **Browse**.

4. Select the **SkyTalk_call_center_application_21.0.2_Vxx.twx** file and click **Open**.

5. Click **OK**.

6. After the import, hover over the **SkyTalk call center Application** tile and click **Open**.

7. Click the **gear icon** in the upper right hand side.

8. Select the **Advanced** view mode (1) and click **Save** (2).

9. Refresh the page and make sure you have access to the **Advanced** menus.

**[Go to top](#top)**
10 - Reconnect the application to the Decision Service
This step may have to be repeated after you deploy a new version of your decision service. Make sure that only the latest deployed DS is published. IT may prevent from having "Data renaming issues" when re importing the new service.
1. Click the **Diagram** tab.

2. Click the **SkyTalk_rentention_ds** node (1), then click the **Implementation** tab (2).

3. Click **New...**

4. Select **skytalk_retention_ds**.

5. Click **Add (1)**.

6. Close the view that just appeared by clicking **(X)**.

7. Make sure operation is set to **retentionOffer** (1) and click **Data Mapping** (2).

8. Make sure you have no errors in the data mapping section, then click **Preview** to test the application.

9. Pass the security checks and enlarge the panel to see the entire view.

10. Enter **"Peter Carter"** (1) and click **Search** (2).

11. Click **Get offer**.

12. You should see the offer.

You are ready to demo.
**[Go to top](#top)**
11 - Un-deploy your ML
At the end of your demonstration, complete these steps:
1. Go in the **SkyTalk production space** and un-deploy your two ML services from your deployment space.

2. Click on the **Deployments** tab (1) and click **Delete** in the right hand side menu (2).

3. Confirm the deletion, and then delete the second deployment in the same way. This will stop the billing system and your quota will not be consumed any more.

4. Remove the **churn prediction** you created in the **Retention offer** decision in the **SkyTalk Initial retention**.

5. Remove the **Churn Predictive** model you created in the **SkyTalk customer retention DS** decision service.
**[Go to top](#top)**
Second demo scenario
If you have un-deployed your ML models after the previous demonstration, you will have to perform some operations to reset the demo as shown on the process map at the top of this document.
1. Re-deploy your two ML models in Watson studio by repeating **Step 4** operations. From that step your Watson Studio free quota will be consumed.

2. Re-configure your two models in ADS. Repeat **Step 7 operations**.

3. Deploy a new version of your decision service. Repeat **Step 8 operations**.

4. Reconnect your decision service in app designer. Repeat **Step 10 operations**.

**[Go to top](#top)**
Click [here](/300-business-automation-predictive-decisioning/demo-script) to go to **Demo Script** on the next tab.

MdxNode.rawBody:
--- title: Predictive decisioning 300-level live demo description: Predictive decisioning 300-level live demo tabs: [ 'Demo preparation', 'Demo script'] --- export const Title = () => ( Predictive decisioning
300-level live demo ); ![banner](./images/proactive-incident-resolution-300-script-github-banner.jpg) BANNER NEEDED | DEMO OVERVIEW | | | :--- | :--- | | **Scenario overview** | This demo shows how the IBM Cloud Pak for Business Automation integrates machine learning to improve decisions. To illustrate this, a company’s customer retention offer process is automated. | | **Demo products** | Cloud Pak for Business Automation V21.0.2, Cloud Pak for Data 4.0 | | **Demo capabilities** | Decision management, Predictive Services integration, Rapid application development | | **Demo guidance** | This demonstration uses three main components from two Cloud Paks:

1. **IBM Watson Studio** - AutoAI form Cloud Pak for Data (AI part)

2. IBM Business Automation Studio / **Automation Decision Services (ADS)** in Cloud Pak for Business Automation (Business rules part)

3. IBM Business Automation Studio / **Application Designer** in Cloud Pak for Business Automation (Final application part)

This demo script has multiple tasks, that each have multiple steps. In each step, you have the details about what you need to do (**Actions**), what you can say while delivering this demo step (**Narration**), and what diagrams and screenshots you will see (**Screenshots**). This demo script is a suggestion, and you are welcome to customize based on your sales opportunity. Most importantly, practice this demo in advance. If the demo seems easy for you to execute, the customer will focus on the content. If it seems difficult for you to execute, the customer will focus on your delivery. | | **How to get support** | Contact #itz-techzone-support regarding issues with reserving and provisioning TechZone environments.

Contact #platinumdemos-automation-support regarding issues with setting up and running this demo use case. |
Introduction
To install the demo, complete these steps in advance:

1. Create your **Cloud Pak for Data** account, and subscribe to **Watson Studio** and **Watson ML**.
2. Have an installation of **Cloud Pak for Business Automation** up and running, or provision a demo instance on ROKS. ### First demo installation process This guide explains how to install and connect the three required environments.
Here is a visualization of this guide’s steps in this guide.

**[Go to top](#top)**
1 - Provision the Cloud Pak for Business Automation environment
Install Cloud Pak for Business Automation 21.0.2, or provision a ROKS environment that will be available for one week at no charge. To book your ROKS instance, follow these steps:

1. Log in to IBM Technology Zone.

2. Click the **Activation Kits** tab (1) and then select the **Cloud Pak for Business Automation Activation Kit** tile (2).

3. Click **Environments - Reserve here!** tab.

4. Select the **Cloud Pak for Business Automation OpenShift Demo Environments** tile.

5. Click the **Preinstalled OpenShift Environments** tab (1) and then the **Preinstalled CP4BA - V21.0.2IF003 on Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud (ROKS)** tile (2).


6. Select **Reserve now**. Enter the requested information and select a preferred location to host your instance.


7. You will receive a confirmation email that confirms the instance is provisioning.

8. You will receive a second email once the environment is provisioned. This email contains information, such as URLs, that allow you to connect to the instance.
If you have issues connecting to your instance, please contact TechZone support or refer to the installation documentation here.


9. Once you receive this email, it will take an additional 6-8 hours for the system to fully install Cloud Pak for Business Automation. After the waiting period is over, click the **Cluster URL** from the email you have received.

10. Ensure you are on the **ITZ account**.

11. Ensure there are no **Alerts** for the cluster.

12. Click the **OpenShift web console** blue button on the top right corner of the screen.

13. Expand **Workloads** (1) and click **Config Maps** (2).

14. Select the **dtecp4ba** project.

15. Search for **access** in the search area.

**Note**: If your CP4BA install process went well you should see the file called “icp4adeploy-cp4ba-accesss-info”. If not, please refer to the ROKS help or contact the TechZone support: techzone.help@ibm.com .

16. Click the **icp4deploy-cp4ba-access-info** file.


17. Scroll down to the **BAStudio** section.

18. Bookmark the **environment URL** (1) and keep a copy of the username and password (2) to log in CPABA.


19. Scroll down to the **gitea-access-info** section and note the credentials that are necessary when setting up ADS.


20. Connect to your gitea environment using the URL and credentials provided. Click through the privacy messages and click **Sign In**.

21. Enter the same **Username** and **Password** (1) provided in the access file and click **Sign in** (2).

22. Click **+** to create the git repository.

23. Name the repository **“SkyTalk_customer_retention.”** (1). Click **Create repository** (2).

**Note**: Ensure there are no spaces in the name.

24. Keep a copy of the repository URL required later for the ADS configuration.

**[Go to top](#top)**
2 - Create and set up your Watson Studio account (free)
1. Go to IBM Cloud.

2. Enter your **IBM ID**. If you do not have one, create a new one.

3. Click **Create resource**.

4. Type **Watson** (1) in the search field and then select **Watson Studio** (2).

5. Select the **Lite** plan (1), and a **location** (2). Read and accept **license agreements** (3). Click **Create** (4).

6. Return to the **IBM Cloud**.

7. Click **Create Resource**.


8. Type “Machine”(1) and then select **Machine Learning** (2).

9. Select the **Lite** plan (1) and a **location** (2). Read and accept **license agreements** (3). Click **Create** (4).

10. Return to the **IBM Cloud**.

11. Click **Create Resource**.

add links 12. Type **Object** (1) and then select **Object Storage** (2).

13. Select the **Lite** plan (1), and click **Create** (2).

14. Click the **top menu** (1) and then **Resource list** (2).

You should see your three services. Click **Watson Studio-2D**.

15. Click **Launch in IBM Cloud Pak for Data**.

16. Click **New deployment space**.

17. Name the production space "**SkyTalk production space**" (1). Set Cloud the storage service to **Cloud Object Storage-ep** (2). Set the **Machine Learning-nm** to **Create a new machine learning service** (3). Click **Create** (4).

18. Click **Close**.

19. Click the **IBM Watson Studio** logo at the top left-hand side of the page to return to the home page.
**[Go to top](#top)**
3 - Set up the two Machine learning models
At this stage, the Watson Studio environment is completely set up. The three services (Watson Studio, ML, and Storage) are ready, and the deployment environment is set up. Now let’s create the two prediction services using AutoAI in Watson Studio.
Ensure the 2 data files have downloaded prior to starting this step.


(ADD LINKS)

1. Click **New Project** from the Watson Studio home page.

2. Select **Create an empty project**.

3. Name your project **"SkyTalk customer retention"** (1) and click **Create** (2).

4. Click **Add to project**.

5. Select **AutoAI experiment**.

6. Name your AutoAI experiment **SkyTalk churn prediction** (1) and click **Associate a Machine Learning service instance** (2).

7. Select your service instance (1). Click **Associate Service** (2) in the blue ribbon.

8. Click **Reload**.

9. You should be ready to click **Create**.

10. Click **Browse**.

11. Select the **SkyTalk customer loyalty data.csv** file you downmloaded from.

12. When prompted **"What do you want to predict?"**, select **Churn**.


13. Click **Run Experiment**.

14. Let the tool work (two minutes) until the eight pipelines are created.

15. Scroll down to access the pipeline list, and **Save as** Pipeline as a model.

16. Select **Model**, and click **Create**.


17. You should see a **Saved Model Successfully** message.

18. Return to the **SkyTalk customer retention** project.

19. Click **New AutoAI experiment**.

20. Repeat the operation to create a new AutoAI experiment from another data file. Repeat all the steps from bullet 9, and browse the **SkyTalk customer value data.csv** file (1). Name your experiment **SkyTalk lifetime value prediction** (2), and select **Lifetime value** (3) as the column to predict.

21. After creating the model (->step 18), return to the project view. Click **SkyTalk customer retention**.

22. At this step, you should have your two models ready to be published in your deployment space.

23. Go over the first model, and click **Promote**.

24. Select your deployment space and click **Promote**.

25. Repeat the instructions from **step 23** with the second model.

26. Return to the IBM Watson Studio home page, and click your deployment space.


30. Go in the **Assets** tab.

31. Your two machine learning services are now ready to be deployed.
**[Go to top](#top)**
4 - Deploy your ML models
Your ML services will be accessible to other applications once deployed. 

**NOTE:** Your free quota will be consumed as soon as the service is deployed. Don't forget to remove the deployments as soon as you are done with your demonstration. Follow the **Un-deploy your ML models** step to un-deploy the services and to stop the billing process.
1. From your Watson Studio environment, go in your deployment space.

2. Go to the **Asset** tab.

3. Deploy the CHURN prediction by clicking the corresponding rocket icon that appears when you hover the RHS of the row.

4. Select **Online** (1) and name your deployment **Churn** (2). Then click **Create** (3).

5. Deploy the lifetime value prediction clicking on the corresponding rocket icon that appears when you hover the RHS of the row.

6. Select "online" (1) and name your deployment "Lifetime value" (2) and click **Create** (3).

7. Click the **Deployment** tab. Your two services should be deployed.

**NOTE:** You are now charged until you remove the deployments from that table by selecting **Delete** on the right hand side of the row. This is the un-deploy phase which you will have to perform after each demo.
**[Go to top](#top)**
5 - Get the credentials to set up the ML provider
This section explains how to get the various elements needed to set up the machine learning provider in ADS. 1. Go in your deployment space / deployment tab (1) and click the **churn** deployment (2).

2. Copy the **endpoint URL** path (the selection highlighted in blue) and keep it handy for the upcoming ML provider configuration.

3. Click **SkyTalk product space** in the breadcrumb menu.

4. Go to the **Manage** tab.

5. Copy the deployment **Space GUID** by clicking on the **Copy** icon. Keep it handy for the upcoming Machine Learning provider configuration.

6. Log out and return to your IBM Cloud environment (1) and make sure you are on the account used to set up Watson Studio (2).

7. Go in the **Manage** tab, and select **Access (IAM)**.

8. Click **API keys** (1) and then **Create an API key** (2).

10. Give a name to your key (1) and click **Create** (2).

11. Download the API key file and keep it ready for the ML provider configuration.

**[Go to top](#top)**
6 - Open ADS and import your ADS demo project
In this step, you are going to import the rules project in ADS. Make sure you have uploaded the ADS project file called "SkyTalk-Customer-Retention_21.0.2_Vxx.twx". ADD LINK once posted
1. Log in to your Cloud Pak for Business Automation instance. Use the URLs and credentials from **steps 1-25** in this documentation if you are using ROKS.

2. Expand the top menu (1) and click the Business Automation menu (2).

3. Pass through the privacy warning messages by clicking "Advanced " and then "Proceed..." link

4. Under **Business automations**, click **Create / Decision automations**.

5. Name your automation **"SkyTalk customer retention DS"** (1) and click **Create**. (2)

6. Accept any privacy checks that may appear.

7. Close any Guided tour views.

8. Click the "Import" button.

9. Select your **"SkyTalk-Customer-Rentention_21.0.1_VXX.zip"** file and click **Open**. ADD LINK WHEN POSTED

10. Click "Import".

11. Configure your ADS environment by clicking "..." and then **Settings** next to the project name.

12. In the **Remote Git repositories** tab, copy the git repository URL from step 1.21 (1). Enter the git username and password you have in your ROKS access file (see step 1.21). (2) Click **Connect**. (3)

13. Ensure the **Remote Git repository** status is **Connected.**

14. Make sure your two ML services are deployed on the IBM Watson studio side (refer to step 4).

15. Click the "Machine learning providers" tab to configure the machine learning provider.

16. Click **New**.

17. Name your ML **"SkyTalk ML provider"** (1). Enter the API key (2), Space ID (3), and URL (4) that you got from step 5 and click **test connection**.

17. Your ML provider should be up and running. Click **Save**.

22. Click **SkyTalk customer retention DS in the breadcrumb**.

**[Go to top](#top)**
7 - Update the decision model with the deployed ML models
1. Click the **SkyTalk retention decision service** tile.

2. Click the **Customer Churn** model.

3. Click**Connect**.


4. Select your ML provider.

5. Expand the churn prediction model (1), select your churn deployment (2), and click **Next** (3).

6. Click **Next**.

7. Click **Run** to test the invocation.

8. Click **Next**.

9. Click **Generate from test output**.

10. Click **OK**.

11. Click **Apply**.

12. Return to the skytalk retention DS.

13. Click **Customer lifetime value** and repeat operations 3 to 12, expending and selecting the **Customer lifetime value ML** model.

14. When that is complete, click the **Retention Offer** model.

15. Select the **Run (3)** tab.

17. Select the **High Value profile** test file (1) and click **Run** (2).

18. You should see a retention offer with an upgrade to PREMIUM for Sarah Miller displayed. Click run again if you get a timeout error the first time. Click **SkyTalk customer retention DS**.

**[Go to top](#top)**
8 - Deploy your Decision service
1. Select the **Share changes** tab.

2. Select all the changes (1) and click **Share** (2).

3. Click **Share** to push your updates to your git repository.

4. Go into the **View history** tab.

5. Refresh the page and click **Version +** in your latest shared history.

6. Enter version name **"V1"** (1) and click **Create** (2).

7. Click the **Deploy** tab.

8. Expand your latest version (V1) (1), and click **Deploy** (2) in the SkyTalk retention DS row. **Note**: Do not deploy the Skytalk initial retention DS.

9. Click **Deploy** to confirm.

10. Once the deployment is finished, select the **Business Automation** tab.

11. You should see your latest deployed service. Click **Publish**.

12. In the **Publish automation services** window, click **Publish**.

13. Confirm the service appears as **Published**.

**[Go to top](#top)**
9 - Configure Application Designer and import the client application
For this step, make sure you have downloaded the **SkyTalk_call_center_application_21.0.2_Vxx.twx** archive file.

INCLUDE LINK 1. Open the top menu (1), go into **Design** (2), and click **Business applications** (3).

2. Click **Import**.

3. Click **Browse**.

4. Select the **SkyTalk_call_center_application_21.0.2_Vxx.twx** file and click **Open**.

5. Click **OK**.

6. After the import, hover over the **SkyTalk call center Application** tile and click **Open**.

7. Click the **gear icon** in the upper right hand side.

8. Select the **Advanced** view mode (1) and click **Save** (2).

9. Refresh the page and make sure you have access to the **Advanced** menus.

**[Go to top](#top)**
10 - Reconnect the application to the Decision Service
This step may have to be repeated after you deploy a new version of your decision service. Make sure that only the latest deployed DS is published. IT may prevent from having "Data renaming issues" when re importing the new service.
1. Click the **Diagram** tab.

2. Click the **SkyTalk_rentention_ds** node (1), then click the **Implementation** tab (2).

3. Click **New...**

4. Select **skytalk_retention_ds**.

5. Click **Add (1)**.

6. Close the view that just appeared by clicking **(X)**.

7. Make sure operation is set to **retentionOffer** (1) and click **Data Mapping** (2).

8. Make sure you have no errors in the data mapping section, then click **Preview** to test the application.

9. Pass the security checks and enlarge the panel to see the entire view.

10. Enter **"Peter Carter"** (1) and click **Search** (2).

11. Click **Get offer**.

12. You should see the offer.

You are ready to demo.
**[Go to top](#top)**
11 - Un-deploy your ML
At the end of your demonstration, complete these steps:
1. Go in the **SkyTalk production space** and un-deploy your two ML services from your deployment space.

2. Click on the **Deployments** tab (1) and click **Delete** in the right hand side menu (2).

3. Confirm the deletion, and then delete the second deployment in the same way. This will stop the billing system and your quota will not be consumed any more.

4. Remove the **churn prediction** you created in the **Retention offer** decision in the **SkyTalk Initial retention**.

5. Remove the **Churn Predictive** model you created in the **SkyTalk customer retention DS** decision service.
**[Go to top](#top)**
Second demo scenario
If you have un-deployed your ML models after the previous demonstration, you will have to perform some operations to reset the demo as shown on the process map at the top of this document.
1. Re-deploy your two ML models in Watson studio by repeating **Step 4** operations. From that step your Watson Studio free quota will be consumed.

2. Re-configure your two models in ADS. Repeat **Step 7 operations**.

3. Deploy a new version of your decision service. Repeat **Step 8 operations**.

4. Reconnect your decision service in app designer. Repeat **Step 10 operations**.
